intro: Radinosiphon holostachya, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Radinosiphon holostachya is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive appearance.
